title: (x) Various Surf fonts - various {gang}
content:
I would love to know this title font. It was published in the mid 70’s. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/surf_magazine_5929.jpg)

 [‹ (x) St.Tropez Tanning Essentials logo - ITC Avant Garde Gothic, Bodega Sans {Marc O}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31672 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) "Letters From Iwo Jima" movie logo - Trajan {Dan R, Mili Carr} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.typophile.com/node/31679 "Go to next forum topic")
author: apparatus™

comments.content: Radical. Most likely not a font, and if so, I haven’t seen it available digitally. Have a look at [Mercano Empire](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=DF.113527.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=SURF&sampleSize=144) and [BQE](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.identikalshop.com/font_ind.php?baseProductID=8) which may have been influenced by the same typeface.

Thanks Stephen. I can definitely see the influence it has made on BQE! It’s very similar. This typeface was used quite commonly in surfing magazines around early 70’s. While we are on this subject I have another a few others from similar time that I would love to know they are:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/wave1_3857.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/SMOKN_3667.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/sundown_4391.gif)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/afrls_6335.jpg)

afrts - dunno. alts: [Braggadocio](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=M.267.0.1&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=afrts&sampleSize=48) or [Futura Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=verity.search&startrow=1&records=100&currpage=1&totalrecords=8&searchby=&searchID=&searchletter=&searchstr=futura+black&font_categories_checkbox=font_name_search&fontRendererText=afrts)  
sundown - Bookman with swash, available from ITC/Monotype or [Veer](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.veer.com/partner/link.aspx?i=1048&c=4&p=products/typedetail.aspx?image=JBT0000085).

Thanks again Stephen!  
Bookman with swashes is so nice!

Just an addition to the above SURF-Poster: [Glyphic Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeco/glyphic-neue/) has similarities, also [Glare](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.dafont.com/glare.font?text=SURF) by DustBust from the free/shareware-departments.

Thanks so much for your suggestions guys. Smokn is definitely Omnia...  
Any suggestions on the record sticker ’afrts’ ? Also is the below typeface ’Premier’ :

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/proseries_4899.gif)
  
And another (I promise this is the last one ;-))  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/73b1_1_6194.JPG.jpg)

[Premier](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.2726.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=PRO+SERIES&sampleSize=48) is close, but there may be another interpretation that is closer.

My god, that’s the ugliest Neil cover ever. It’s using something like [Busorama](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=ITC.6534.0.3&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=TIME+FADES+AWAY&sampleSize=48).

Haha! I know somone got excited with those fonts! haha!  
That said do you know the face that ’Neil Young’ is written in?  
Oh, this was a Dutch released 45 pic sleave.

I’m guessing (hoping?) that “neil young” is not a font and is custom designed. It looks like it was made from perfect semicircles and straight lines.

- Lex

“Surf” is a typeface called Deutsch Black (Homage to the Alphabet p.136).  
“Time Fade Away ...” is [Marvin](http://web.archive.org/web/20081205155748/http:/typophile.com/node/18584).
